table_description: DigitalOcean's managed database service simplifies the creation and management of highly available database clusters. Currently, it offers support for PostgreSQL, Redis, and MySQL.

columns.name: id
columns.description: A unique ID that can be used to identify and reference a database cluster.

columns.name: name
columns.description: A unique, human-readable name referring to a database cluster.

columns.name: engine
columns.description: A slug representing the database engine used for the cluster. The possible values are: \"pg\" for PostgreSQL, \"mysql\" for MySQL, and \"redis\" for Redis.

columns.name: version
columns.description: A string representing the version of the database engine in use for the cluster.

columns.name: connection_database
columns.description: The name of the default database.

columns.name: connection_host
columns.description: A public FQDN pointing to the database cluster's current primary node.

columns.name: connection_password
columns.description: The randomly generated password for the default user.

columns.name: connection_port
columns.description: The port on which the database cluster is listening.

columns.name: connection_ssl
columns.description: A boolean value indicating if the connection should be made over SSL.

columns.name: connection_uri
columns.description: A connection string in the format accepted by the psql command. This is provided as a convenience and should be able to be constructed by the other attributes.

columns.name: connection_user
columns.description: The default user for the database.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Time when the database was created.

columns.name: db_names
columns.description: An array of strings containing the names of databases created in the database cluster.

columns.name: firewall_rules
columns.description: A list of rules describing the inbound source to a database.

columns.name: maintenance_window_day
columns.description: The day of the week on which to apply maintenance updates (e.g. \"tuesday\").

columns.name: maintenance_window_description
columns.description: A list of strings, each containing information about a pending maintenance update.

columns.name: maintenance_window_hour
columns.description: The hour in UTC at which maintenance updates will be applied in 24 hour format (e.g. \"16:00:00\").

columns.name: maintenance_window_pending
columns.description: A boolean value indicating whether any maintenance is scheduled to be performed in the next window.

columns.name: num_nodes
columns.description: The number of nodes in the database cluster.

columns.name: private_connection_database
columns.description: The name of the default database.

columns.name: private_connection_host
columns.description: The private FQDN pointing to the database cluster's current primary node.

columns.name: private_connection_password
columns.description: The randomly generated password for the default user.

columns.name: private_connection_port
columns.description: The port on which the database cluster is listening.

columns.name: private_connection_ssl
columns.description: A boolean value indicating if the connection should be made over SSL.

columns.name: private_connection_uri
columns.description: A connection string in the format accepted by the psql command. This is provided as a convenience and should be able to be constructed by the other attributes.

columns.name: private_connection_user
columns.description: The default user for the database.

columns.name: private_network_uuid
columns.description: A string specifying the UUID of the VPC to which the database cluster is assigned.

columns.name: region_slug
columns.description: The unique slug identifier for the region the database is deployed in.

columns.name: size_slug
columns.description: The slug identifier representing the size of the nodes in the database cluster.

columns.name: status
columns.description: A string representing the current status of the database cluster. Possible values include creating, online, resizing, and migrating.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: An array of tags that have been applied to the database cluster.

columns.name: urn
columns.description: The uniform resource name (URN) for the database.

columns.name: users
columns.description: An array containing objects describing the database's users.
